recipes.title: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 76
recipes.description: A classic upside-down cake with caramelized pineapple and cherries.

instructions.text: Melt margarine in a 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pan. Stir in sugar and 1 tablespoon water.
Arrange pineapple and cherries in the pan.
Prepare batter for Busy-Day Cake; spoon into the pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Loosen sides; invert onto a plate. Serve warm.

notes: Serve warm

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 76)

recipes.title: Apricot Upside-Down Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 76
recipes.description: Upside-down cake variation with apricots or peaches and coconut.

instructions.text: Prepare as for Pineapple Upside-Down Cake, except substitute one 8-1/2-ounce can apricot halves, drained and halved, or peach slices, drained, and 2 tablespoons toasted coconut for the pineapple and cherries.

notes: Variation of Pineapple Upside-Down Cake

missing_inputs: Not in database: apricot halves or peach slices
Not in database: Batter for Busy-Day Cake

recipes.title: Pear-Raisin Upside-Down Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 76
recipes.description: Upside-down cake variation with pears and raisins.

instructions.text: Prepare as for Pineapple Upside-Down Cake, except substitute one 8-1/2-ounce can pear slices, drained, and 2 tablespoons raisins for the pineapple and cherries.

notes: Variation of Pineapple Upside-Down Cake

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 76)

recipes.title: Busy-Day Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 77
recipes.description: Stir up this one-layer cake in only minutes with easy-to-keep-on-hand ingredients.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, and baking powder. Add milk, margarine or butter, egg, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute.
Pour batter into a greased and floured 8x1-1/2-inch round baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.

Frost warm cake with Broiled Coconut Topping, if desired. Or, cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove cake from pan. Cool thoroughly. Serve with whipped cream and fresh fruit, if desired.

notes: EASY recipe
Microwave directions available

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for Broiled Coconut Topping
Assumed 1 unit for whipped cream and fresh fruit

recipes.title: Spiced Pecan Busy-Day Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 77
recipes.description: A spiced variation of Busy-Day Cake with pecans, walnuts, or peanuts.

instructions.text: Prepare as for Busy-Day Cake, except add 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg or allspice with the flour.
Stir in 1/2 cup chopped pecans, walnuts, or peanuts after beating.

notes: Variation of Busy-Day Cake

missing_inputs: Not in database: ground nutmeg or allspice

recipes.title: Wheat and Raisin Busy-Day Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 77
recipes.description: A whole wheat variation of Busy-Day Cake with raisins or dates.

ingredients.item: raisins or snipped pitted whole dates

instructions.text: Prepare as for Busy-Day Cake, except reduce all-purpose flour to 1 cup and add 1/3 cup whole wheat flour to flour mixture.
Sprinkle 1/4 cup raisins or snipped pitted whole dates atop batter in the baking pan.

notes: Variation of Busy-Day Cake

recipes.title: Yellow Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 77
recipes.description: Delicious with just a dusting of powdered sugar.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, and baking powder. Add milk, margarine, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes.
Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more. Pour into 2 greased and floured 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool thoroughly on racks.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 77)

recipes.title: Citrus Yellow Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 77
recipes.description: Yellow cake with orange or lemon peel, filled with Lemon Filling.

ingredients.item: finely shredded orange peel or finely shredded lemon peel

instructions.text: Prepare as for Yellow Cake, except add 2 teaspoons finely shredded orange peel or 1 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel to the flour mixture.
Fill with Lemon Filling (see recipe, page 90) and frost with Lemon or Orange Butter Frosting (see recipe, page 89), if desired.

notes: Variation of Yellow Cake

missing_inputs: Not in database: finely shredded orange peel or finely shredded lemon peel
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for Lemon or Orange Butter Frosting

recipes.title: White Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 78
recipes.description: Buttermilk flavors this light, tender cake.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add buttermilk, shortening, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl. Beat on medium to high speed for 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.
Add egg whites and beat for 2 minutes more, scraping bowl.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Loosen sides. Remove from pans. Cool thoroughly on wire racks.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 78)

recipes.title: Spice Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 78
recipes.description: One of our taste testers exclaimed, 'It's perfect!'

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and ginger.
Add buttermilk or sour milk, margarine or butter, shortening, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined. Beat 2 minutes on high speed. Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more.
Pour batter into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 78)

recipes.title: Carrot Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 79
recipes.description: To match the picture on page 73, frost with Cream Cheese Frosting (see recipe, page 88) and top with walnut halves and strips of orange peel.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon.
Add carrot, oil, and eggs. Beat with an electric mixer till combined.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove cakes from pans. Cool thoroughly on racks.

notes: Frost with Cream Cheese Frosting (page 88)

recipes.title: Gingerbread
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 80
recipes.description: A moist, spiced cake with molasses flavor.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, baking powder, and baking soda.
Add shortening, molasses, egg, and 1/2 cup water. Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes.
Pour into a greased and floured 8x8x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a rack 10 minutes. Remove from pan; serve warm.

notes: Microwave directions available

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Banana Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 81
recipes.description: A moist cake made with ripe bananas.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Add banana, buttermilk, shortening, eggs, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined. Beat on medium speed for 3 minutes.
Pour batter into 2 greased and floured 8x1-1/2- or 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool on racks for 10 minutes. Remove from pans; cool on racks.

recipes.title: German Chocolate Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 81
recipes.description: A rich chocolate cake made with German sweet cooking chocolate.

ingredients.item: margarine or butter, softened, or shortening

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine chocolate and 1/3 cup water; cook and stir over low heat till melted. Cool.
In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, soda, and 1/8 teaspoon salt.
Add chocolate mixture, milk, margarine, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes.
Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more. Pour into 2 greased and floured 8x1-1/2- or 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 40 minutes or till a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool on racks 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool on racks. Frost with Coconut-Pecan Frosting.

notes: Frost with Coconut-Pecan Frosting (page 90)

recipes.title: One-Layer Chocolate Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 81
recipes.description: Just the right size for one meal and a few snacks.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Add milk, shortening, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Add egg and beat 2 minutes more. Pour into a greased and floured 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool thoroughly on a rack.

notes: EASY recipe
Microwave directions available

recipes.title: Fudge Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 82
recipes.description: Satisfy those chocolate cravings with this luscious layer cake.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add water, shortening, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes.
Add eggs and melted chocolate; beat 2 minutes more.
Pour batter into 2 greased and floured 8x1-1/2- or 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove cakes from the pans. Cool thoroughly on wire racks.

recipes.title: Black Forest Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 82
recipes.description: This traditional German dessert is a wonderful combination of chocolate and cherries.

instructions.text: Prepare Fudge Cake; cool thoroughly. Prepare Choose-a-Fruit Filling using cherries; chill well. Prepare Chocolate Butter Frosting.
Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Using 1 cup of the frosting, make a border around the edge of the layer 1/2 inch wide and 1 inch high.
Using 1/4 cup more of the frosting, make a solid circle in the center of cake layer about 2-1/2 inches in diameter and 1 inch high.
Spread the chilled filling between the frosting border and the circle.
Place second cake layer on top. Frost with remaining frosting. If desired, garnish with dollops of whipped cream and chocolate shavings.
Chill. Let stand at room temperature 20 minutes before serving.

notes: Chill before serving
Let stand at room temperature 20 minutes before serving

missing_inputs: Not in database: Choose-a-Fruit Filling (cherry option)
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for Chocolate Butter Frosting

recipes.title: Devil's Food Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 83
recipes.description: A classic rich chocolate layer cake.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Add milk, shortening, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes.
Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more. Pour into 2 greased and floured 9x1-1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool on racks 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool on racks.

recipes.title: Pound Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 83
recipes.description: Pound cake originally was made with a pound each of butter, sugar, eggs, and flour. We cut the recipe but kept the rich flavor.

instructions.text: Bring butter and eggs to room temperature. In a mixing bowl stir together flour, baking powder, and, if desired, nutmeg.
In another bowl beat butter with an electric mixer on medium speed for 30 seconds.
Gradually add sugar to butter, 2 tablespoons at a time, beating on medium to high speed about 6 minutes total or till very light and fluffy. Add vanilla.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating 1 minute after each addition, scraping bowl often.
Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating on low to medium speed just till combined.
Pour batter into a greased and floured 9x5x3-inch loaf pan.
Bake in a 325° oven for 55 to 65 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove cake from pan. Cool thoroughly on a wire rack. Drizzle Powdered Sugar Icing over cake, if desired.

notes: Bring butter and eggs to room temperature before starting

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 83)

recipes.title: Sponge Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 84
recipes.description: A hint of orange accents this moist, tender cake.

instructions.text: In a bowl beat egg yolks with an electric mixer on high speed about 5 minutes or till thick and lemon colored.

Add orange peel, juice, and vanilla. Beat at low speed till combined. Gradually beat in the 1 cup sugar at low speed. Increase to medium speed; beat till mixture thickens slightly and doubles in volume (about 5 minutes total).
Sprinkle 1/4 cup flour over yolk mixture; fold in till combined. Repeat with remaining flour, 1/4 cup at a time. Set yolk mixture aside.

Thoroughly wash beaters. In a large bowl beat egg whites and cream of tartar at medium speed till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add the 1/2 cup sugar, beating at high speed till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight).
Fold 1 cup of the beaten egg white mixture into the yolk mixture; fold yolk mixture into remaining white mixture. Pour into an ungreased 10-inch tube pan.
Bake in a 325° oven for 55 to 60 minutes or till cake springs back when lightly touched near center.
Immediately invert cake (leave in pan); cool thoroughly. Loosen sides of cake from pan; remove cake from pan.

notes: Do not grease pan
Invert immediately after baking to cool

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 84)

recipes.title: Jelly Roll
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 86
recipes.description: Make a yule log by using apricot jam. Frost with chocolate frosting and draw bark lines with a fork. Pumpkin Cake Roll is pictured below right.

instructions.text: Combine flour and baking powder; set aside.

In a mixing bowl beat egg yolks and vanilla with an electric mixer on high speed for 5 minutes or till thick and lemon colored. Gradually add the 1/3 cup sugar, beating on high speed till sugar is nearly dissolved.
Thoroughly wash beaters. In another bowl beat egg whites on medium speed till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add the 1/2 cup sugar, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight).
Fold yolk mixture into beaten egg whites. Sprinkle flour mixture over egg mixture; fold in gently just till combined.
Spread batter evenly into a greased and floured 15x10x1-inch jelly-roll pan.
Bake in a 375° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till cake springs back when lightly touched near center.
Immediately loosen edges of cake from pan and turn cake out onto a towel sprinkled with powdered sugar. Roll up towel and cake, jelly-roll style, starting from one of the cake's short sides.
Cool on a rack. Unroll cake; remove towel. Spread cake with jelly or jam to within 1 inch of edges. Roll up cake.

notes: Roll while warm, then cool, then unroll to fill

missing_inputs: Not in database: jelly or jam
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for sifted powdered sugar

recipes.title: Pumpkin Cake Roll
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 86
recipes.description: A spiced pumpkin cake rolled with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Prepare as for Jelly Roll, except add 2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice to flour mixture and stir 1/2 cup canned pumpkin into egg yolk and sugar mixture.
Fill with Cream Cheese Frosting (see recipe, page 88). Roll up cake.
Sprinkle with sifted powdered sugar.
*Note: For another filling, try 2 cups softened ice cream. Freeze ice-cream-filled roll.

notes: Variation of Jelly Roll
Can fill with ice cream and freeze

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 86)

recipes.title: Fruitcake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 87
recipes.description: A traditional fruitcake with candied fruits, nuts, and molasses. Store in refrigerator for 2 to 8 weeks to mellow flavors.

ingredients.item: diced mixed candied fruits and peels, or snipped mixed dried fruit
candied red or green cherries, quartered
chopped pecans, walnuts, or toasted slivered almonds

instructions.text: Grease an 8x4x2-inch loaf pan. Line bottom and sides of pan with brown paper to prevent overbrowning; grease paper.
In a bowl combine flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, nutmeg, allspice, and cloves. Add fruits and peels, raisins, cherries, and nuts; mix well.
Beat eggs; stir in sugar, juice, margarine, and molasses till combined. Stir into fruit mixture.

Pour batter into pan. Bake in a 300° oven for 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 hours or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. (Cover pan loosely with foil after 1 hour of baking to prevent overbrowning.)
Cool in pan on rack. Remove from pan. Wrap cake in brandy- or fruit-juice-moistened cheesecloth. Overwrap with foil.
Store in the refrigerator for 2 to 8 weeks to mellow flavors. Remoisten cheesecloth about once a week, or as needed.

notes: Store in refrigerator 2-8 weeks to mellow flavors
Remoisten cheesecloth weekly

recipes.title: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 76

instructions.text: Melt margarine in a 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pan.
Stir in sugar and 1 tablespoon water. Arrange pineapple and cherries in the pan.
Prepare batter for Busy-Day Cake; spoon into the pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Loosen sides; invert onto a plate.
Serve warm.

notes: Apricot Upside-Down Cake: Prepare as above, except substitute one 8 1/2-ounce can apricot halves, drained and halved, or peach slices, drained, and 2 tablespoons toasted coconut for the pineapple and cherries.
Pear-Raisin Upside-Down Cake: Prepare as above, except substitute one 8 1/2-ounce can pear slices, drained, and 2 tablespoons raisins for the pineapple and cherries.

recipes.title: Busy-Day Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 77
recipes.description: Stir up this one-layer cake in only minutes with easy-to-keep-on-hand ingredients.

ingredients.item: Broiled Coconut Topping or whipped cream and fresh fruit (optional)

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, and baking powder. Add milk, margarine or butter, egg, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute.
Pour batter into a greased and floured 8x1 1/2-inch round baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Frost warm cake with Broiled Coconut Topping, if desired. Or, cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove cake from pan. Cool thoroughly.
Serve with whipped cream and fresh fruit, if desired.

notes: Microwave directions: Prepare batter as above, except increase margarine or butter to 1/3 cup. Grease an 8x1 1/2-inch round baking dish; line bottom of dish with waxed paper. Pour batter into dish. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 50% power (medium) for 10 minutes, giving the dish a quarter-turn every 3 minutes. If not done, cook on 100% power (high) for 30 seconds to 2 minutes more or till surface is nearly dry. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Loosen, then invert onto a wire rack; remove waxed paper. If desired, place cake on a baking sheet and frost with Broiled Coconut Topping (do not put baking dish under broiler). Or, cool cake thoroughly. Serve with whipped cream and fruit, if desired.
Spiced Pecan Busy-Day Cake: Prepare as above, except add 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg or allspice with the flour. Stir in 1/2 cup chopped pecans, walnuts, or peanuts after beating.

Wheat and Raisin Busy-Day Cake: Prepare as above, except reduce all-purpose flour to 1 cup and add 1/3 cup whole wheat flour to flour mixture. Sprinkle 1/4 cup raisins or snipped pitted whole dates atop batter in the baking pan.

recipes.title: Yellow Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 77
recipes.description: Delicious with just a dusting of powdered sugar.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Add milk, margarine, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined.
Beat on high speed for 2 minutes. Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool thoroughly on racks.

notes: Citrus Yellow Cake: Prepare as above, except add 2 teaspoons finely shredded orange peel or 1 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel to the flour mixture. Fill with Lemon Filling (see recipe, page 90) and frost with Lemon or Orange Butter Frosting (see recipe, page 89), if desired.

recipes.title: White Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 78
recipes.description: Buttermilk flavors this light, tender cake.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Add buttermilk, shortening, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl.
Beat on medium to high speed for 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.
Add egg whites and beat for 2 minutes more, scraping bowl.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Loosen sides. Remove from pans. Cool thoroughly on wire racks.

notes: Lady Baltimore Cake: Prepare as above. Prepare Seven-Minute Frosting (see recipe, page 87). For filling, combine one-fourth of the frosting, 1/3 cup chopped candied cherries, 1/2 cup chopped pecans, and 1/2 cup snipped pitted whole dates, chopped figs, or raisins. Spread filling between layers. Frost with remaining frosting.

Petits Fours: Prepare as above, except pour batter into a greased and floured 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 40 to 45 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes; remove from pan. Cool thoroughly. Prepare Petits Fours Icing (see recipe, page 88). Trim sides of cake to make smooth, straight edges. Cut cake into 1 1/2-inch squares, diamonds, or circles. With fingertips, brush off crumbs. Place cake pieces on wire racks over waxed paper. Insert a 2- or 3-prong long-handled fork into the side of one cake piece. Holding cake over icing, spoon on enough icing to cover sides and top. Place on a wire rack. Repeat with remaining cake pieces. (Sides of pieces should not touch.) Let dry 15 minutes. Repeat for a second coat of icing, except place cake pieces atop prongs of the fork (do not spear). Repeat for a third layer of icing, if desired. Reuse the icing from the waxed paper, straining crumbs, if necessary. Makes 36 to 40.

recipes.title: Spice Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 78
recipes.description: One of our taste testers exclaimed, 'It's perfect!'

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and ginger.
Add buttermilk or sour milk, margarine or butter, shortening, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined.
Beat 2 minutes on high speed. Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more.
Pour batter into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.

notes: Nutmeg Cake: Prepare as above, except omit cinnamon, cloves, and ginger. Increase nutmeg to 1 1/2 teaspoons.
Applesauce Spice Cake: Prepare as above, except reduce buttermilk or sour milk to 1/4 cup and add 1 cup applesauce.

recipes.title: Pumpkin-Molasses Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 79
recipes.description: Complement the flavor of this moist cake with Lemon Butter Frosting (see recipe, page 89).

ingredients.item: canned pumpkin or mashed cooked sweet potato

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and ginger.
Add buttermilk, shortening, pumpkin or sweet potato, molasses, and orange peel.
Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined.
Beat on high speed for 2 minutes. Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more.
Pour into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.

recipes.title: Date Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 80
recipes.description: Don't worry about letting this light cake cool thoroughly. It's delicious served warm.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine one 8-ounce package (1 1/2 cups) pitted whole dates, snipped, and 1 cup boiling water; cool to room temperature (about 1 hour). Do not drain.
In a bowl combine 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Add date mixture, 1/2 cup shortening, 2 eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes.
Stir in 1 cup chopped nuts.
Pour into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack. Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

recipes.title: Banana Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 81

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Add banana, buttermilk, shortening, eggs, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined.
Beat on medium speed for 3 minutes.
Pour batter into 2 greased and floured 8x1 1/2- or 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool on racks for 10 minutes. Remove from pans; cool on racks.

recipes.title: German Chocolate Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 81

ingredients.item: margarine or butter, softened, or shortening

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine chocolate and 1/2 cup water; cook and stir over low heat till melted. Cool.
In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, soda, and 1/8 teaspoon salt.
Add chocolate mixture, milk, margarine, and vanilla.
Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes.
Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 8x1 1/2- or 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 40 minutes or till a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool on racks 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool on racks.
Frost with Coconut-Pecan Frosting.

recipes.title: One-Layer Chocolate Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 81
recipes.description: Just the right size for one meal and a few snacks.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Add milk, shortening, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined.
Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. Add egg and beat 2 minutes more.
Pour into a greased and floured 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool thoroughly on a rack.

notes: Microwave directions: Prepare batter as above, except substitute softened margarine or butter for shortening. Grease the bottom of a 2-quart ring mold, line with waxed paper. Pour batter into the mold. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 50% power (medium) for 10 minutes, giving dish a quarter-turn every 3 minutes. If not done, cook on 100% power (high) for 30 seconds to 2 minutes more or till surface is nearly dry. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Invert onto a plate; remove waxed paper. Cool.
One-Layer Mocha Cake: Prepare as above, except add 1 to 2 tablespoons instant coffee crystals to the milk; stir to dissolve.
One-Layer Peanut Butter and Chocolate Cake: Prepare as above, except reduce the shortening to 2 tablespoons and add 1/4 cup peanut butter to the flour mixture.

recipes.title: Fudge Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 82
recipes.description: Satisfy those chocolate cravings with this luscious layer cake.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add water, shortening, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on low to medium speed till combined.
Beat on high speed for 2 minutes. Add eggs and melted chocolate; beat 2 minutes more.
Pour batter into 2 greased and floured 8x1 1/2- or 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove cakes from the pans. Cool thoroughly on wire racks.

recipes.title: Black Forest Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 82
recipes.description: This traditional German dessert is a wonderful combination of chocolate and cherries.

instructions.text: Prepare Fudge Cake; cool thoroughly.
Prepare Choose-a-Fruit Filling using cherries; chill well.
Prepare Chocolate Butter Frosting.
Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Using 1 cup of the frosting, make a border around the edge of the layer 1/2 inch wide and 1 inch high.
Using 1/4 cup more of the frosting, make a solid circle in the center of cake layer about 2 1/2 inches in diameter and 1 inch high.
Spread the chilled filling between the frosting border and the circle.
Place second cake layer on top. Frost with remaining frosting.
If desired, garnish with dollops of whipped cream and chocolate shavings.
Chill. Let stand at room temperature 20 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Devil's Food Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 83

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Add milk, shortening, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined.
Beat on high speed for 2 minutes. Add eggs and beat 2 minutes more.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool on racks 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool on racks.

notes: Sour Cream Devil's Food Cake: Prepare as above, except reduce milk to 1 1/4 cups and add 1/2 cup dairy sour cream with the milk.

recipes.title: Sour Cream Pound Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 83

instructions.text: Bring 1/2 cup butter, 3 eggs, and 1/2 cup dairy sour cream to room temperature.
Combine 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon baking powder, and 1/8 teaspoon baking soda.
In a bowl beat butter with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds.
Gradually add 1 cup sugar, beating about 10 minutes or till very light and fluffy.
Add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Add eggs, one at a time, beating 1 minute after each addition and scraping bowl often.
Add flour mixture and sour cream to egg mixture alternately, beating on low to medium speed after each addition just till combined.
Pour into a greased and floured 8x4x2- or 9x5x3-inch loaf pan.
Bake in a 325° oven for 60 to 75 minutes or till a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool on a rack 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool.

notes: Lemon-Poppy-Seed Pound Cake: Prepare as above, except substitute 1/2 cup lemon yogurt for sour cream. Add 1 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, and 2 tablespoons poppy seed to batter.
Blueberry Sour Cream Pound Cake: Prepare as above, except gently fold 1/2 cup fresh or frozen blueberries into the batter.

recipes.title: Sponge Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 84
recipes.description: A hint of orange accents this moist, tender cake.

instructions.text: In a bowl beat yolks with an electric mixer on high speed about 5 minutes or till thick and lemon colored.
Add orange peel, juice, and vanilla. Beat at low speed till combined.
Gradually beat in the 1 cup sugar at low speed. Increase to medium speed; beat till mixture thickens slightly and doubles in volume (about 5 minutes total).
Sprinkle 1/4 cup flour over yolk mixture; fold in till combined. Repeat with remaining flour, 1/4 cup at a time. Set yolk mixture aside.
Thoroughly wash beaters. In a large bowl beat egg whites and cream of tartar at medium speed till soft peaks form (tips curl).
Gradually add the 1/2 cup sugar, beating at high speed till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight).
Fold 1 cup of the beaten egg white mixture into the yolk mixture; fold yolk mixture into remaining white mixture.
Pour into an ungreased 10-inch tube pan.
Bake in a 325° oven for 55 to 60 minutes or till cake springs back when lightly touched near center.
Immediately invert cake (leave in pan); cool thoroughly.
Loosen sides of cake from pan; remove cake from pan.

notes: Lemon or Lime Sponge Cake: Prepare as above, except substitute 2 teaspoons finely shredded lemon peel or lime peel for the orange peel and 1/4 cup lemon juice or lime juice plus 1/4 cup water for the orange juice or pineapple juice.
Chocolate Sponge Cake: Prepare cake as above, except omit orange peel. Reduce flour to 1 cup. Stir 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder into the flour.
Almond Sponge Cake: Prepare as above, except omit shredded orange peel and add 1/2 teaspoon almond extract with the orange juice or pineapple juice.

recipes.title: Hot-Milk Sponge Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 85
recipes.description: Great with Broiled Coconut Topping (see recipe, page 90).

instructions.text: Combine flour and baking powder. In a bowl beat eggs with an electric mixer on high speed about 4 minutes or till thick.
Gradually add sugar; beat at medium speed for 4 to 5 minutes or till light and fluffy.
Add flour mixture; beat at low to medium speed just till combined.
In a saucepan heat and stir milk and margarine till margarine melts; add to batter, beating till combined.
Pour into a greased 9x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till a toothpick comes out clean.
Serve warm or cool.

recipes.title: Angel Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 85
recipes.description: Eat your cake and diet, too. Angel Cake is low in calories and has no fat.

ingredients.item: sifted cake flour or sifted all-purpose flour

instructions.text: Bring egg whites to room temperature.
Sift powdered sugar and flour together 3 times.
In a large bowl beat egg whites, cream of tartar, and vanilla with an electric mixer on medium speed till soft peaks form (tips curl).
Gradually add sugar, about 2 tablespoons at a time, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight).
Sift about one-fourth of the flour mixture over beaten egg whites; fold in gently. (If bowl is too full, transfer to a larger bowl.)
Repeat, folding in remaining flour mixture by fourths.
Pour into an ungreased 10-inch tube pan.
Bake on the lowest rack in a 350° oven for 40 to 45 minutes or till top springs back when lightly touched.
Immediately invert cake (leave in pan); cool thoroughly.
Loosen sides of cake from pan; remove cake.

recipes.title: Chiffon Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 85

ingredients.item: sifted cake flour or all-purpose flour

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Add oil, yolks, orange and lemon peels, vanilla, and 3/4 cup cold water.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined. Beat on high speed 5 minutes or till satin smooth.
Thoroughly wash beaters. In a bowl combine egg whites and cream of tartar. Beat till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight).
Pour batter in a thin stream over beaten egg whites; fold in gently.
Pour into an ungreased 10-inch tube pan.
Bake in a 325° oven for 65 to 70 minutes or till top springs back when lightly touched.
Immediately invert cake (leave in pan); cool.

recipes.title: Jelly Roll
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 86
recipes.description: Make a yule log by using apricot jam. Frost with chocolate frosting and draw bark lines with a fork. (Pumpkin Cake Roll is pictured below right.)

instructions.text: Combine flour and baking powder; set aside.
In a mixing bowl beat egg yolks and vanilla with an electric mixer on high speed for 5 minutes or till thick and lemon colored.
Gradually add the 1/3 cup sugar, beating on high speed till sugar is nearly dissolved.
Thoroughly wash beaters.
In another bowl beat egg whites on medium speed till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add the 1/2 cup sugar, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight).
Fold yolk mixture into beaten egg whites. Sprinkle flour mixture over egg mixture; fold in gently just till combined.
Spread batter evenly into a greased and floured 15x10x1-inch jelly-roll pan.
Bake in a 375° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till cake springs back when lightly touched near center.
Immediately loosen edges of cake from pan and turn cake out onto a towel sprinkled with powdered sugar.
Roll up towel and cake, jelly roll style, starting from one of the cake's short sides. Cool on a rack.
Unroll cake; remove towel. Spread cake with jelly or jam to within 1 inch of edges. Roll up cake.

notes: Chocolate Cake Roll: Prepare as above, except reduce flour to 1/3 cup and omit baking powder. Add 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder and 1/4 teaspoon baking soda to flour. Fill with 2 cups whipped cream or cooled chocolate pudding. Roll up cake. Drizzle half of Chocolate Glaze (see recipe, page 89) over cake. Chill.

Pumpkin Cake Roll: Prepare as above, except add 2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice to flour mixture and stir 1/2 cup canned pumpkin into egg yolk and sugar mixture. Fill with Cream Cheese Frosting (see recipe, page 88). Roll up cake. Sprinkle with sifted powdered sugar.
*Note: For another filling, try 2 cups softened ice cream. Freeze ice-cream-filled roll.

recipes.title: Nut Torte
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 87
recipes.description: A blender or a food processor makes for fast mixing of this rich cake.

instructions.text: Stir together flour, baking powder, and orange peel; set aside.
In a blender container or food processor bowl place eggs and sugar. Cover and blend or process till smooth.
Add nuts. Blend or process about 1 minute or till nearly smooth.
Add flour mixture; blend or process just till combined.
Spread batter evenly into 2 greased and floured 8x1 1/2-inch round baking pans.
Bake in a 350° oven about 20 minutes or till lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove from pans; cool thoroughly on racks.
Frost with Chocolate Butter Frosting.
